Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8eM6rQrcZYOqp6FJmicnlw.text: We had my moms birthday here with 20 people. They prepared an amazing menu for us and our server Tracy was amazing!  One of the best linguini with clams I've ever had. The porcini mushroom ravioli was absolutely incredible.

Rr6RMamEaEJnV-7rg6crEA.text: Really good Italian food, it's the real deal! We liked everything we ordered. Go early thought because the favorites run out!

RJRz6IRJSRFceDjGXYMD8A.text: Saw the great reviews on yelp and had high hopes for this restaurant. However we're terribly disappointed. When I get there I realized a lot of the yelp photos and reviews are from years ago. The mussels and farro was tasty but both of the pasta dishes were overcooked and the flavor just wasn't there. The whole experience leave a lot to be desired not a restaurant I would recommend.

fbjne5Vz8-KvmDmyvcLcGg.text: We made a reservation for two. A few minutes after we arrived we were shown a tiny table, sandwiched between two occupied tables, and asked if that was okay, which it clearly was not. The place is small and was packed, including a couple of large parties. We were told it was 20 minutes for another table. The restaurant should not take reservations if it doesn't have the capacity to seat them comfortably.

3F_BiQlLNF8GfYxDtcaE8Q.text: Our visit started off rocky and ended with "meh". We had a reservation but upon arrival we were told there was a wait. Okay, a few minutes, I can understand. But after about 10 minutes the host wanted to seat us at a high top near the bar. We asked if we could sit at a regular table, but because it was set for four, the host didn't want to seat us there :/ (although there was another table of 2 sitting at a 4-top). He ended up seating us there but it didn't leave us with a good first impression.  Onto the food...  Calamari - not good, very little flavor. A little salt in the batter would've made a big improvement. The marinara sauce was good so it made the dish edible, but without it, the calamari would've been tasteless.  Wild Mushroom Ravioli - outstanding! Perfectly cooked and seasoned with a hint of truffle.   Shrimp Parmesan - not what we were expecting, it's like chicken Parmesan but with shrimp. The shrimp is battered and fried with melted cheese on top.  Gnocchi Bolognese - again, sauce was good but the gnocchi had no flavor. Maybe they ran out of salt in the kitchen?? I asked my husband if he tricked me by taking me to a "healthy" restaurant (read: no salt, no flavor). The gnocchi was cooked well, but I was disappointed.   Service was a little slow, but the restaurant was busy. I don't think we'll be back, unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi Bolognese
Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari - don&#39;t order it

xFNwhytOHuoEkuNJOLX4Iw.text: This restaurant and service personnel, including the chef are superb - as well as the food.  Everything is made in-house except for the cannelloni shells. We ate here twice in one week and that is something we never do.  It was really, really good.    Reservations are a must as they have a base of regulars and deservedly so.  The chef came out on our first visit and spent some time explaining the menu items. Our server was prompt, polite and extremely knowledgeable as well as honest in his explanations.  The wine is fairly priced - about 1 and 1/2 to 2 times what it sells for at Lee's.  Everyone made us feel at ease and very welcome.    On our second visit, they called me ahead of time to ask if I would mind a different table assignment - very thoughtful.  They also prepared a dish, not on the menu that evening - just for us.  Their menu specials change daily.  We will visit Marc's  on a regular basis.  Plan on around $140 for a couple if you get a nice bottle of wine, entrees, sides and dessert.  Non drinkers, thrifty types can share a main dish and side, drink water and can get out for less than $30 - $35.  But what's the fun in that?  They have happy hour specials, but we have not tried them yet.  It gets noisy on busy nights, but not as bad as some restaurants I've visited.  Wouldn't surprise me if they outgrew this facility in the future.  I highly recommend this place.

-LNgWm4Lle9Z_0ylDcRrpg.text: Based on the great reviews so many fellow Yelpers have given this place had me looking forward to trying this quaint hidden place for a while. Upon entry, I was greeted by the kind gentleman host. I saw my friend over at the bar, she walked over and then we were seated.  The space for this restaurant is intimate and small. The warm tones of the interior made us feel cozy on this rainy evening. I chose to drink a glass of the Super Tuscan wine. I then chose the Chicken Marsala. This is one of my favorite dishes so I try it wherever I am if I see it on the menu. I also ordered a bowl of the Lobster Bisque. My friend chose the Shrimp Scampi over Linguine. The Lobster Bisque was rich, creamy and flavorful. There were nice size chunks of Lobster in the Bisque which I was surprised to see. Not a lot of them but enough. Next came the entrees. My dinner selection was the wrong choice in this instance. I found the sauce to be a little too sweet and it did not compliment the chicken. The mushrooms were very good though. There was also a side of zucchini which I also liked. My friend really loved her shrimp scampi and it was lovely presentation. Both entrees were big so we ended up taking a to go bag. I waited and waited for Chef Marc to come over to our table which so many Yelpers had stated in their reviews but he never did. I saw him go to other tables though. No big deal! I would probably return one more time to try something else. It may have been an off night so a return trip might be in order.

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala
Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi, mmmmm
Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

dUBOYjEVvqO54iLZmCkwfg.text: Place is great. I spoke to Marc at 11am on friday to make a reservation and told him i am a chef from NY and i expect the best and he did not disappoint. The Meatballs with Sunday Sauce was like being at Nona's house on Sunday in Brooklyn for family dinner. I also had the Ravioli Special with Shaved truffle and it was mouthwatering. We also had the Carpaccio and wasnt really feeling it, could use some truffle oil and dijon mustard. The meal was great though, highly recommended!

9-BUPhz36fw43CxO4gvJRw.text: Some of the best Italian I've ever experience. We dined at @Chef Marc's on a recent visit to Summerlin, and will put this on circulation of choices when in the area. We were joined by a local couple who were not aware of his gift but have been back 2x since.  Fresh made pasta, ever changing specials, one of the most amazing Pork Chips ever, and about that Ora Salmon.... ridiculousness!!!  We will definitely be visiting next time we're in town!  Thank you

1jDagCaNYX0grZl1Q4VNdA.text: I hate giving bad reviews to local spots like this, especially when I see that there is potential, but my experience here back in March should be discussed. It seems like this restaurant used to be a gem, but my visit here was extremely disappointing. The ambience seemed off and generally the restaurant is dated, it doesn't reflect the prices on the menu. The food, I can mostly only attest to the happy hour menu, was uninspired. The meatballs were the epitome of average, the happy hour sausage dish was unremarkable in any way, the salad was just bad there was no craft put in. It doesn't seem like the ingredients here are sourced properly, nor does the food taste made from scratch. It just generally felt like a dead decaying place, the food came nowhere close to the artistic way it's presented through the photos here on yelp in the descriptions in the menu. Places like this need to be cultivated, there should be a robust cocktail list the either evokes Italian spirit culture or 20s speakeasies, a smaller but handcrafted meticulous menu, a more updated decor. I wish the Chef heeds this review, I'd be extremely happy to return and try again. Places like this should be thriving not stagnating in quality.

4s6WlmTJDlv_SS-txL236g.text: This is my new favorite Italian restaurant! This restaurant is very elegant, with professionally dressed waitstaff and a greeter who is super friendly. The entire restaurant has a warm family style feel. First off, the bread basket-it was amazing! The bread you could tell was homemade, and it actually tasted like pizza crust. My favorite part was the pieces of bread that were dipped in sauce which was very unique. My favorite part of the entire meal was the beet salad. I would come here just for that! There were red beets with candied walnuts and Gorgonzola cheese. It was such a unique and tasty mix of extreme flavors. They had an entire menu of daily specials. We tried to bucatini with broccoli rabe and the spaghetti tortuffo. These were both on the very large menu of specials for the day. Both dishes were delicious, with al dente pasta and freshly prepared sauces.

i6LJTxhfQJUZ-PwsMrBHuA.text: Holy shit my mouth wouldn't stop letting me put more food in.   I didn't expect to find such a gem out here.   The servers showed amazing menu knowledge and suggested fantastic dishes. Cold beers and some serious flavor profiles.   10 out of 10 would smash again.   Cookie!

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P8I-49PA2XCN9M0SuRSTaQ.text: Definitely the best Italian food in Las Vegas.  Chef Marc is amazing!!  Ingredients are chosen very carefully and most imported straight from Italy!  You are amazing Chef Marc!!  Keep up the great work!

lxwreunUVcNbqgbn8Q8Fkw.text: First time customer and this is a to go order. I love the service fast and quick. I ordered Chicken Parmesan the food is awesome. The hostess are super nice and the waitress offer me some water while I'm waiting inside and Chef Marc came by and chatting a little bit. Went outside waiting for my to go order at the car didn't expect Chef Marc personally handed me the order. Definitely I'm going back again...

Y9yp8ydH_AMjA6ArQa-iuA.text: Great inspired Italian cusine, chef owned and hands on in the kitchen and an excellent host in the dining room.

bHXD1npNH-kzmwryXaKh4w.text: Yep, that good!  Marc's presentation is superb.  And, the homemade pasta is the best!  Marc is at the restaurant - almost always.  He will make you whatever you want.  I love that about a place - owner/chef accessible to his customers.  It's not just going out for dinner.  It's an intimate setting for a nice night.

hbJkuKb1tvowma3EVfOnKw.text: Great place, excellent service and food. Good wine list. Pasta always made fresh daily. Go back often. Worth a try for sure. Easy to get to but a little hidden. Marc is always talking to guests and Spain's menu options well. Staff very courteous. Pricing is also reasonable.  Can get a little noisy at times and outdoor dining when weather is nice. Enjoy!

fklq3T7NP58XJTCjnvFlvg.text: Warning- a book  We decided to try a new place that our friend recommended, to our surprise it was our old Marc from Marc's on lake mead and tenaya. What a great surprise as we remember the incredible dishes he prepared for us 15 years ago!!! So, appetizers are 1st class - prosciutto n figs are sooo fresh and delicious. Garlic bread is sinful. The lettuce for the salads is unreal and one of a kind. He makes all dressings here!! Already it reminds me of the old restaurant, he always uses the best ingredients. Service is on point as always in his places. Marc STILL goes around and talks to all the tables. He loves what he does and it shows. His agnolotti is dynamite, lamb, chicken and beef. Ask for it!! Oh wait... dinner came.just, look at the pictures and salivate. Bon appetit

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

78ZeC6e1L5Grst8LfZSd4w.text: My family and I went to dine at Chef Marc's Trattoria. We were pleasantly surprised that the food, service, quality of food, the exquisite variety of menu choices and the desserts were absolutely a delight!!! It was like fine dining in a relaxed, warm and inviting atmosphere. Chef Marc approached our table and made wonderful suggestions on that days special menu items. All of the items that he recommended were well thought out, with perfect pasta to sauce ratios, the salad selection was well proportioned with salad dressing and all of the ingredients were in season. Our table shared appetizers, soup and salad and many main entree dishes and desserts were shared family style. There was plenty to eat, without feeling too full.

9SfspkaXUbclvt1t8DLlNA.text: First but Not The Last Visit To Chef Marc's Trattoria. We were surprised to be taken to this restaurant for a friends Birthday. Come to find out that Marc is from Utica NY which is a stone's throw from my Hometown of Syracuse NY. We were Greeted by Luigi in the most gracious Italian style and I Loved It. I asked to talk to Marc & his bartender Sam & they are both Great Friends of one of my Best Friends Johnnie J. Two great guys right here. Upon looking at the Menu I saw Greens & Beans and ordered this. Others ordered Duck & Veal & Chicken Parm. I then asked if they made Utica Greens and the waitress Antoinette looked at me and said Yes we do & what amount of Heat would you like. I chose a #3 and smiled the Biggest Smile I could just because I have not had this dish in over a Decade. I then Enjoyed the Best Utica Greens I ever had. Thx Marc for making this dish the way its supposed to be made. We also enjoyed a great glass of Malbec & Birthday Girl Angela has some Moscato which she Loved. Wine menu was super and they had all kinds that everyone would enjoy. All of our meals were Plentiful and delicious. I can Honestly say that we will return to Marc's as much as Possible, believe me. If you are in the area of 8615 Sahara West do yourself a favor and stop for dinner. Better yet make reservations to be assured of getting in as I know this place will be dynamite for dinner and word of mouth will get around quickly. Please say Hi to Marc & Sam for me.  Buona Salute. Mangia Mangia

ZyAQKvxmHf4dj3sj1Yq1qg.text: Always a good time. Here's two of my favorites. The portobello app is one of the best things I've put in my mouth. The second dish was the first time I've ordered it here: Squid inc pasta w calamari, reminds me of the squid inc pasta from Clarettas back in Florida. perfectly cooked pasta and I loveee the use of calamari instead of shrimp. That 4 cheese spinach mushroom app though. NOTHING beats the bello  if you're not starving it can definitely suffice as an entree but it's fun to try other things. Especially if you get another app or half order of pasta. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid inc pasta
Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello 4 cheese spinach app

KE35EZn57Q9WorPgyxPhhg.text: Reserved our spot for 4 for our annual holiday dinner and we all agreed, it was a delicious meal (recommend you make reservations.) Started with lemon drop martinis and a dirty martini, made via our server's recommended vodka.   Moved on to the mushroom app- made with strong cheeses of Gorgonzola, Romano and pecorino and earthy, meaty mushrooms with spinach. Make sure to save some bread to dip in all the cheesy goodness. Very rich, but very worth it. Both drinks paired well with this appetizer. 5/5  I tried the frutti di mar. The assortment of shellfish were plentiful and fresh. Served in a slightly briney tomato sauce tossed in an especially special pillowy linguine, cooked perfectly and made in house. The sauce coated the fish and linguine with tons of flavor. 5/5  The fella tried a stuffed pasta in red sauce, overall the dish was good but very salty. 3.5/5  Chef Marc stopped by a couple of times to see how we were doing and our server didn't miss a beat. Great evening, all-in-all!

NVXlPvKsLM8f06Dkh70hsQ.text: I have been coming here every time I get to Vegas for the last 8 years...  Food is the best!!!  However I like to bring my own wine...  All I am just saying is that $35 for corkage is ridiculous and rather exorbitant ...  Other than that this place is the bomb!!

p3eDc8WLE8__4bhpwVMMTQ.text: Fantastic amazing authentic Italian Restaurant! I was blessed enough to eat at this spot cause my wife's company Christmas party was held here and was amazed of everything! The type of food was great and even tasted better! The service was top of its class! Specially our server Jiovanna! She was funny, fast, and was on top of all of our request! Chef Marc took the time to come out and explain the menu and how it differs from the rest and why he chose what was on the menu! Drinks were on point! I ordered about 4 Long Island and all taste great! Just enough alcohol to feel good but not really taste the alcohol! Some Long Islands are too strong and you can't even finish the drink but some are not strong enough and it's nothing but an Arnold Palmer but the bartender got it right on point! Overall food quality, service, and drinks were all 5 stars! Even the location, no where near the strip so parking was good! Definitely recommend this restaurant if you are looking for good Italian food!

cTdbG4ScL2imFy9PEv6-Vg.text: Chef Marc's Trattoria is hands down my favorite restaurant in Vegas or anywhere else. Everything I have been served is amazing!  My favorite is Chefs table, a multiple course meal. Every course is a surprise & absolutely delicious. Come hungry & leave satisfied & happy.

IYWuTmDmGrhcBL1XM6tnqw.text: Looking for good, soulful Italian fare. New in town here. have to say I am left intrigued but disappointed at the overall experience. What I liked: fresh bread was fantastic, the tomato flatbread that came hand in hand was too overpowering for side bread. The good quality olive oil they had was enough to carry it through taste wise.  Escargots: I liked that the shells were off, it soaked a buttery tangy sauce. What I didn't like: the croutons with the dish had no correlation in texture or taste wise in compliments with the star of the show. The bread provided had more satisfaction as opposed to the former.  My partner had the veal: Beautifully done. Sauce was fantastic. No complaints except wanting more.  Myself; had the truffle pasta with extra truffle. Pasta made al dante and fresh. This dish is the heart of any altruistic Italian cuisine, emphasising on the focus minimalistic ingredients with maximisation of flavour.   Here is the BIG letdown: desserts. Here is the breakdown   Creme Brulee: taste was good. But why on God's green earth is it cold. Is creme brulee not a warm dessert?! It came cold, the creme was stiff. Bleagh.   Cannoli: All the characters from the godfather would never acknowledge this.... monstrosity. The shell was hard, almost as though it has sat its good length of its shelf life in the freezer... supposed ricotta/cream filling was powdery. Gross. Down right disgraceful on Italian cuisine.   Chocolate mousse cake: in short: tasted worse than what one would bought at Albertsons. Albertsons would have tasted better.   Willing to give the main courses a second shot because i believe it has potential but the dessert I would stay away like a plague. Yes This review is harsh, but when priced at 170++ for food and wine alone one would expect leaving the grounds more satisfied as I had been.

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rk1_Dx4Ji4lDhf8PL7SZ0A.text: This was hands down one of the best 5 meals I've ever eaten.  We drove 4 hours to be there and we didn't regret anything.  The food was amazing, the service was astounding and I cannot recommend this place enough.  We started with the portabella and meatball app,  I'm not a huge mushroom fan but it was delicious.    I had the short rib malfiatti and it was amazing, my friend had the frutti de mare, but he was torn because he wanted to try another dish which had the black pasta, so our amazing server asked the chef to add black pasta to the frutti and he did.   During our dinner Chef Marc came out and made a point to chat with each table and make sure everyone was happy.  This was an amazing overall experience and I can't wait to return.

SER7PEYb10oK_XOR56-UZQ.text: We ate here for the first time tonight and it might be our new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything was delicious from start to finish. The atmosphere was lively without being raucous. Chef Marc introduced himself at the start of our meal and kept in touch throughout to ensure we were enjoying ourselves.  We had the following and everything was great:  - A couple meatballs - Special ricotta and egg raviolo - Veal chop - Veal cheeks - Chocolate mousse cake - Canolo - Espresso - Bread accompaniment  It is hard to pick a favorite part of the meal because everything was so delicious. We would recommend each of the dishes above to anyone.

KFjYMNWrESE6FW6TG3kNhQ.text: For sure, this is one of the best Italian meals I have ever had.  Our server, Giovanna, was truly amazing; from beginning to end the service was spot on and delightful.  It was awesome too, to have Chef Marc stop by our table and offer some suggestions, which turned out to be highlights of the evening.  Without a doubt, I will be back.

_QnkN72kvzU9au_RHzUE-g.text: A local place with fine touch, Marc's is a must! Starting with the service, Chef Marc is charismatic! You can still his accent ! He will come by your table and spend time getting to know your palette but with a New York accent.  The food itself is amazing! Whether you like spice or not Marc has done it again. my absolute favorite local Italian place!

McaVb4O7ZbgeXXqLUaWSAg.text: This is one of the best pastas I have ever tried everything on it was amazing. Hubby and kids had the spaghetti and meatballs. Thumbs up. For dessert of course I had to try the creme brulee, the chef even came out to burn the sugar on it in front of us. Waitresses very attentive.Next time we are in Vegas this place is a must.

pg67oxJF-7FG9hOfFc1s-g.text: Omg seriously amazing food and service! Fresh made pasta, perfect portions and definitely the best tiramisu I've ever had! The bolognese was the closest I've ever had to my family's recipe. Very traditional. Can't wait to go back!

AqMD1ypLjGpK5DlyPp9zDA.text: The best in the city. The best ingredients, the best service, the best care. There's a high bar for the real thing, and Chef Marc raises it to such a unique and personable degree, one can simply taste the awesomeness.   Chef Marc will come meet you personally. His New York City personality is welcoming, passionate for food and fun to listen too. His staff hosts respect and class like private butlers.  The flavor is to not die for, but to relive again and again, each time more luscious and wholesome than the last as seasons change.  Such a charming atmosphere.   I hold it often better if not on par with the best dining spots on the strip today, or any day, for that matter.

HQgVzmJ4mgTGKTwvwj-e_w.text: Nice local Italian vibe - nice and friendly staff - staff seems like family - tonight they were well staffed and nothing overlooked.  Food was very good - looks like we finally found our non-chain local Italian joint.  The charcuterie board was of better quality and quantity compared to about 12 others we have had in west side of town - bread is fresh made and very good.  Meatballs actually have more meat than breadcrumbs - they were a bit crustier than I prefer but wife loved them - veal was also good not the best in town but top 5.  Homemade pasta was good - it was cooked a little too much so not as firm as I like it.  Definately going back.

LDxWFQt0cX2IBvsUej5nnQ.text: I am a fair person and have enjoyed many restaurants around the world. I chose Chef Marc's for my anniversary because of the high rating.  The food, however, was average at best. And plates, less than average, were returned. I may have given a three star rating, but the bill was too high.  The food is simply far too expensive for the quality.  I am puzzled why their rating is so high.

_KeRqOwFyY2ayS4676PnUw.text: Service was very good and the meals were excellent. This was one of the best meals we've had in quite some time. Both wines we selected were very good. For desert the creme brulee was again excellent. We will be visiting again soon.

X9zNvXtpDHzSTR4OduSzjg.text: We have heard nothing but good things about this place, and last night was very disappointing. Place was packed which is awesome, but I feel the staff couldn't handle the amount of people in the restaurant. I ordered shrimp scampi expecting homemade pasta to come with it and the pasta I got was not homemade. Service was just ok we could tell our waiter was over whelmed.  Prices are up there and I don't mind paying if the food knocks my socks off. Total bill for four of us was $300 incl. tip We may give it another chance on a week day when it won't be so busy.

ntR8LMBXy2UC8Af_nxzoeA.text: I loved Chef Marc's old restaurant, but was underwhelmed by my experience here back in January. The breading on the calamari was a soggy, limp mess. Lettuce in the Caesar salad wasn't dried properly making it a watery disaster. The malfiata/deconstructed lasagna was unremarkable. The sauce was lacking in flavor and the whole dish wasn't nearly as good (conceptually or taste-wise) as a traditional lasagna. The special that night -- mafalda with oxtail ragout -- was the highlight of the night. I like the texture of the loosely cut pasta and the ragout was beefy and rich. Since my visit was shortly after they opened, chances are I'll be back to give them another shot.

lQeyEeg1Idc02f5UKNBrYA.text: We went to Marc's for restaurant week to try his 4 course chef's tasting meal. If I could give him 6 stars I would. The food and service were fabulous. All of the other 5 star reviews that are listed are right on!! Just go and enjoy!!!

The amazing warm and friendly staff always welcome me with a hug and Chef Marc himself is table side and in the kitchen making sure your experience is the absolute BEST! We love you Chef Marc!

l7Rg1W6ZdpNbvbMmaf5jSg.text: Went for dinner last Sunday. Ambiance is nice. Not fancy but not casual, just somewhere in between. I like the decor and Chef Marc was out chatting it up with the patrons. The host was super friendly. Our server was nice and had a lot to remember (at least 5 specials which all sounded good.).  The bread to start was fine. But this killed it for me: at a spot like this, please served fresh butter. Not the margarine in the plastic mold where you peel back the plastic and dig your butter knife in. Honestly, even the BF was surprised at this. I will say the wine our was on the heavy side (bonus!).   We started with a Caesar salad. It was fine but not what I expected from Chef Marc having been to Parma and Mezzo Bistro in the past. Dressing lacked a discernible anchovy taste to the point where I can't even say for sure there were anchovy's in the dressing. To me, a Caesar dressing without anchovy is not a Caeser.   I ordered the clam linguini. It was just okay. The dish could have used more salt and sauce. The pasta was kind of clumping together so I think sauce would have helped.   The BF ordered one of the specials, steak with hot peppers. There's a chicken dish on the menu with this preparation but the steak was one of the specials. It was DELICIOUS. The pasta was perfect, steak was good, but the sauce, oh the sauce, it was freaking fantastic! We asked for more bread so we could sop off the sauce. (The second offering of bread was about quarter the size of the first.)  Overall, it was an okay meal. We will definitely go back because having been to Chef Marc's previous restaurants, I know there is potential here. Next time though, I'll order one of the specials.

5D66cwE_ajGk6WTfgqQJqQ.text: This our new favorite off-strip restaurant. The food is truly fabulous, the staff is professional and friendly, and Chef Marc is a stickler for the highest quality ingredients using his own family and time-tested recipes.   One of my personal favorites is the "Nero" dish with seafood and black ink pasta - wow!  Sitting at the bar is a delight with Sam the bartender handling the cocktails and wine with aplomb.   Go and enjoy.

irEpyjjBt8tlsO8QJ4Cmog.text: One of the best meals of my life. Great vibe. 10 ouuuta 10! Amazing pasta. Perfect tiramisu. Go to this place or you're a dork dufus bozo ding dong.

nIT06xxLp9gV-fG3--X3ow.text: Cute place with class. Chef visited with every table multiple times BEFORE we ordered. Wonderful information and personal touch.  Homemade pasta. Yummy. Portobello mushroom appetizer could be split between 4-6 people. Yummy I ordered chicken riggies. Every bite an incredible journey. Yummy Husband had spinach and cheese ravoli w/pink sauce and pancetta. Yummy! Our new go-to place.

rXdNxCsRhwyno9uJTGagaQ.text: First, the food is a 10 star. Everything Chef Marc is as good as it can get. I have eaten there many times and it is amazing. I would say he is similar to, but way better than Giada's. The only reason i did not give it 5 stars is because the service is spotty. Sometimes it is good. But when it is crowded, it is a problem.  My suggestion is to go other than Friday or Saturday nights.

DyzREOff54zT4QS7ev1FnA.text: I have to rate this place as delicious - I take all friends & family who visit Las Vegas here - never disappointed!!  I have had most items on the menu - all are authentic, fresh & served with great integrity & skill!!  Chef Marc oversee's all and nothing leaves that kitchen if it's not perfect!!  Tracy is our favorite waiter ....  favorite dishes ... Linguini & shrimp scampi, chicken piccata, pasta bolognese.  Enjoy !!   Great happy hour ... definitely try the meatball!!!

Br01CxUUPzQS829h7PjhRg.text: We have eaten here twice. Excellent every time. The Chef is very personable and describes the food wonderfully. Will be back again and again.

ujU7Cqy0ed9cWZv1Vlx-3Q.text: I don't write reviews often but this amazing place deserves one! I came here for my birthday and it was the best decision :) The food was so delicious and every bite was just as good as the first. Chef Marc and his staff were so welcoming and genuinely cared about us during our entire meal. Our server Tracy was and is hands down the best server I've ever met!! You have to try this gem :)

VgvBYBw8RqBLHwbRMvnCIQ.text: Chef was super nice and came out because we had some special requests.my wife dish was amazing but my chicken Marsala was dry and chewy. On our salad plate we had few ANTS we show to to our waiter -that explained that as organic veggies is sometimes part of it-I don't buy it come on!! We ordered the check and they didn't even discount us for the ANTS salad, of course that I could made a big deal of that and start behaving like an animal and I could get at list 50% off,but I was thinking that a restaurant with a $25 avg dish coat will respect them self and will discount it just because they want me as a happy customer.THAY WASNT THE CASE We paid the full amount without saying anything and we left.probably I won't come back

xXHE3J-8imZiP76bHUNmmQ.text: If I have a hankering for Italian, Chef Marc's is the where I'm going. When you eat the food there, you can really taste the "love" in the food. Some of my faves are the portabello appetizer, chicken riggies, and chicken marsala. Can't get enough of Chef's bolognese sauce. Can I just hook that sauce up to my veins? Thanks, Chef Marc for amazing food!

6X0Jh7VkufSMjymib_83XA.text: Delicious food & great service!  Everything is always fresh and consistent.  You can tell there's a passion for food and it's nice to have Chef Marc stop by your table.

95BeKSYtZ5fatZMPc1OL8Q.text: Well let me start by saying we LOVE Chef Marc.  Love his passion for what he does, love talking to him in the restaurant, love the excitement he has when he is describing a dish he is concepting or preparing.   Very cool.   We are actually not from Vegas, but went a number of times to PARMA, his other place which closed down in 2015.   We loved the food there and the vibe, and were excited to come try his new place knowing what we know.    That being said, I can't say I will be back.  :(    The food was - well, unextraordinary.  If I am going to drive from the strip where I normally stay to a more local's place (which I did for Parma a bunch of times), I have to leave feeling I had an amazing meal.  That didn't happen here.  (This would be a 3.5 star review if it could be ).  We started with his warm portabello spinach salad, something he served at Parma off the menu if you knew to order it.  Yummy.   With it they brought out a basket of bread.   There was some warm chewy italian bread at the bottom of the basket, and on top were some strips of something covered in sauce and a bit of cheese.  The first thing I noticed as I grabbed them was how cold and mushy they were.  Kinda like if you grabbed an old cold sponge from your neighbor's sink?   The consistency was NOT nice.  Took one bite and set it aside.  Why serve that?  Even complementary.  Yuk.  The garlic bread Marc served at Parma was amazing, one of my favorite parts of the meal, and that was an opinion shared by many people I brought there over the years.  This bread basket didn't come close.  We got the Pasta Fagiole soup as well.  White bean soup, but really, looked like just a bowl of white beans in a white sauce.  I rarely if ever add salt and pepper to restaurant dishes, but this  soup needed lots of help.  Not only did it look unappetizing, it didn't taste like much either.   We actually didn't finish it, which is sad.    We shared two main courses, A veal saltimbocca (one of my favorites) and a spaghetti carbonara.   The dishes were presented nicely, but taste wise, they were bland.  I was really sad.  I LOVE a good meal and was really excited to come here.   The veal portion was large, but the taste was, well, just meh.  Again we didn't finish the dish.  And the Carbonara, which I know is open to all kinds of debate as to whether to add cream (non traditional) vs. just egg and cheese, that's all good but our dish.. well.   Have you ever seen food if it sat under a heat lamp a really long time?  Kinda dried out and tired?   That was what I thought of when I had this.  Just clumpy, sticky, stiff, and lacking flavor on top of it.   And believe me it makes me sad to write that.  It just didn't meet our expectations.    Service started out well, but after we were served the main courses our waiter disappeared.  GONE.  When I wanted a check ( half hour or 45 minutes after) I finally flagged down another waiter and asked for it, and then our waiter appeared to give it to us.  Not cool.     We brought in our own bottle of wine, which we do from time to time.   I am cool with a corkage fee, I think the restaurants should make something, so that doesn't bother me.  A $25 corkage fee, though, I think is a bit excessive.   You should be forewarned if you are planning on bringing in your own wine.    I really would love it if Marc read this, and maybe changed some things.  I'd love to see him thrive, and I am rooting for him.   Maybe it is assistant chefs not following his recipes, maybe some of his dishes just need a bit of tweaking, but the way it is right now, I can find better restaurants in Vegas to head to when I am there visiting.

v5wkLc3CWe1f50esaqezMQ.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Chef Marc was personable, informative and genuinely cared that we enjoyed our meals.  Will definitely be back!

jsgAnFIN8w5yczs5Vi53xw.text: This is the only place I eat pasta in Las Vegas. Everything is homemade and chef Marc only sources the best quality products; so I just do the Chef Tasting and Wine Pairing Menu, plus I'll order a table wine (to keep us going between pours).  I just tell him fish, meat, spicy or creamy...whatever I'm in the mood for and he hits it out the park every time.  I've spent 20 odd years in Vegas so I have a special kind of despise for the strip and I just want to say, sincerely, it's places like this (and all of his prior restaurants) that make living here so great.  Top, top Italian-American food...and if you know your shit; you can get amazing traditional Italian food here too.

qcWNV4Cn8f1DoGPfVcdueQ.text: My admiration for Chef Marc is no secret: I've followed him through three restaurants and offshoot VPN Novecento pizza joints with a dedication usually reserved only for Deadheads on tour. He is that good: nay, great!   The things I most enjoy about Marc are his genuine passion for Italian/Italian-American cuisine interspersed with his Asian and world travel influences on his menus. He cooks from his soul, and it shows when he talks with love about the food, decor, and his vision for your dining experience. The menu will be a work in progress; I can suggest for sure that the $60 five course "Chef's Surprise" tasting menu will be fantastic; he creates inspired cuisine and sources locally when possible.   So impressed with my dinner last evening that my Parental Units are booking their holiday block party with him, and along with hubby, were already waiting for him to open to have our Vegas post elopement celebration meal.   Years ago Nelson hosted epic UYEs at Parma, I expect Marc to eclipse the high bar he set for those and the scores of meals shared with family and friends enjoyed over the years. Marc is the real deal, I'm borderline sad I live in AZ now, because I'd be eating here once a week!  * Cold Seafood Salad appetizer was amazing *  ** House baked bread is soft and perfect for sopping up the tasty sauces **  *** Mozzarella en Carozza is Italian grilled cheese comfort food ***  **** I created Wild Shrimp and Mussels in spicy white sauce = amazing! ****  ***** house made pastas are perfection *****  Shout out to Lino, our Italian waiter, and Tracey, who Parma regs will recognize.   Have the Creme Brulee torched table side, and thank me later.

He sat us right away. The wait staff, that's right the staff, assisted us immediately with drinks. We ended up ordering a meatball appetizer, the special with steak, and the chicken marsala. Everything was impeccable from the timing of bringing out each plate of food, to the taste of the food itself. I can't believe we have lived in Las Vegas for 13 years and have never stumbled in here.  Go, you won't regret it.

VYBrT3FI8CgzQU8iv2L8Fg.text: Oh, where to begin?! Ok, lets just say that if you are visiting Las Vegas or you if you live there Chef Marc's is a must!  The Food: Ever have one of those meals where everything was a hit and the whole party was beyond satisfied at the end of the meal? If you have, then you will re-live that experience with Chef Marc. If you haven't, stop reading at get over there now!   The Wine: They have a fantastic selection with a sommelier who is at the ready to help you select the perfect bottle.   The People:  For me, this is the most important part of the dining experience. From top to bottom, the crew at this restaurant are amazing and awesomely personable. I have never seen a chef walk around to each table and talk about their food with such enthusiasm. Each member of the staff made if feel like we were regulars.   This is the place to be!

Kju5tTsfgk-JT6hIqDOCAA.text: I am so excited chef Marc is back with a new concept and new space.  I love this place; for certain will be returning regularly.  Sincerely impressed with the good mix of old school Italian charm and hospitality and modern twist to traditional Italian dishes but always inspired by its roots.     I couldn't decide on one dish so I did the tasting menu. I loved everything presented in front of me.   The fried zucchini flower with uni just knocked my socks off and my favorite tasting dish of the night.  Unexpected was the the fava bean leaves(salad)...completely unexpected and expanded my horizons in salad greens.  Perfectly seasoned and a nice light dish before the remaining three dishes and dessert (surprise).  The Argentinian Srimp Pasta was well balanced, and the veal was just perfect.   What is more exciting is really the experimentation and usage of fresh and wholesomely raised ingredients, as well as influence of Asian techniques and ingredients. Forgive me for not using the correct terms but basically Chef Marc is really raising the bar by experimenting.  I love it and I am game for every experimental dish as I love tasting every brilliant bite.   So excited to come back and just keep experimenting (eating!), as it makes each occasion a new and different one.

Y_BbIlXIxUi8zonagMJvjA.text: Excellent as expected.  Server was terrific and very informative.  We had very pleasant and delicious dishes, Chicken Parmesan, Pork Bolognese with Pappardelle, and lasagna.    I liked the fact that there was a break between appetizers and dishes.   We were seated immediately.  Second time there and was not disappointed.

OrnRTbJr5IDvvA58ClgZPw.text: A great Italian meal and great service with a local hole in the wall feeling. This location is a hike from home for me, but if I lived closer I'd come here often.   The meal started with a nice glass of Riesling that I enjoyed. The bread with dipping oil was delicious as well. The Caesar Salad was a generous portion and good.   My Wild Shrimp Fra Diavola was the highlight of the meal. This dish comes with the option of spice level ranging from one to four and I opted for a two which added some heat without losing any flavor. The shrimp was so good and fresh! I also loved the housemade pasta and delicious red sauce. I'd definitely order this dish again. For a sweet ending my friend and I shared the Banoffee Pie. I was excited to see this rare dessert on the menu and loved the flavor of the pie. It was a refreshing summer dessert.   Our service throughout the meal was excellent. Our server was Sam if memory serves me right. Regardless, our server was professional and enhanced our dining experience. Our drinks were refilled often and anything we requested was provided quickly.

oMs3r6Hl2YkeKVMqhQmzRQ.text: This was one of the most extraordinary dining (and eating) experiences I've ever had. The quality ingredients and symphonic way flavors blend together on one plate is exemplary. Chef Marc himself talked us through the menu, discussing his creation process for dishes and some of the trusted places he sources from. He also checked in with us later in the meal and his staff members were all highly attentive and kind throughout the evening.   The menu has both traditional and adventurous dishes - something for everyone. Chef Marc is a master of his craft and loves what he does, which is woven into his food. I guess the secret ingredient really is love.

QRCgoee7q7Tnl9MgKJQzlA.text: Amazing food and beyond friendly staff. They really knew their stuff and it seemed as if it was run by a close family. I would HIGHLY recommend. All the dishes were fresh and made from scratch. There was 6 of us and all of us got something different and put our dishes on the lazy Suzan in the middle of the table and tried everything. -NDVJKca2BWF78UZdRnODw.text: Full Disclosure: If you don't get anything else - get the Portobello App!  I dined here for a birthday. The atmosphere was comforting; not extremely fancy but not casual either. I made a Yelp reservation and the process was great. The staff was very nice and attentive. Our waiter was very descriptive about every dish we asked about; he definitely knew his stuff! Chef Marc graciously greeted every table in the restaurant - you don't get to see the chef that often in other places.  Let's start with appetizers. As previously mentioned - THE PORTOBELLO APP. It was amazingly delicious. The main ingredients were quite simple: portobello mushrooms, cheese, and spinach. It may not sound like much but I promise you, it is!  Frutti Di Mare w/ black pasta: This was good - but not my favorite. It smelt and tasted like the ocean. I absolutely love seafood but it was a little overwhelming for my taste. However, it was jam packed with seafood. & I got a cute fork & little bowl break open my shellfish.  Short Rib Malfatti: Not bad at all - the short ribs and pasta were cooked perfectly.   To be completely honest, the entrees didn't excite me; but it could be because I was too busy wishing I had more of my portobello appetizer!  Dessert: Creme Brulee & Berry Sorbet  The Creme Brulee was smaller than I wish it would be (I love dessert) but it was still a nice way to end my meal. The berry sorbet was amazing! A perfect palette cleanser  and amazingly fresh.   Maybe I should have an appetizer and dessert reservation this week...

We ordered a bottle of wine, it was delivered and then we waited and waited and waited. Chef Marc, always makes rounds to the tables, greats his quests. He did so, last night but again we were ignored. He never came by our table, as he has done every time I have dined there. We finally flagged over our waiter and asked her for some bread. She seemed put out, to be having to even wait on us. Had a definite attitude, borderline rude. We finally ordered dinner. Another server delivered it. He asked how everything was, we told him the other server was less than par. He then stepped it up, was attentive and friendly. The food is always stellar, and  a highlight of the evening. The second server made the balance of our evening enjoyable. Without him, I would have given 2 stars, but gave 3 because the food is great, and the atmosphere enjoyable. But, with the awful service we received I'll have to think twice about going back.

9ilYqBNCcqiYpeZk00IHVw.text: Located in The Lakes off of Sahara & Durango, it's pretty much behind the Best Western or just east of. You can easily miss it as it is a huge center. Parking is super easy as there were plenty of spots available.   Restaurant is closed Monday's and Tuesday's so make sure you pay attention, do make a reservation as it can get packed. The restaurant is already fairly popular on this side of town, there's plenty of buzz about it. The ambience is pretty classy. I'd say dress formal, I know it's Vegas but it's in a nice area and has more "mature" crowd.   I like to have a few drinks by the bar before I sit, they have a good house cab and offer beers. The pasta fagiole is awesome, please try it if you like soups. The chicken parm is perfection, just enough cheese where your not drowning in it and definitely plentiful.   The service was impeccable, I've been here 4 times already and they always offer something new or different. Chef Marc is very detailed and descriptive, the way he talks about his process shows how passionate he is about his food and restaurant. I'm from back east and there aren't to many Italian joints off the strip than can compare to this joint, won't disappoint.

aXNAvxVbwEu7DUGD5kKe8Q.text: On Friday night (9 June 2017) we got reservations. Service was what I expected and did not disappoint, but the entree DID!    Our starters were great, but the BLACK PASTA With truffle cream, peas, topped with "Jumbo Lump Crab" was ruined by the fishy smelling & tasting faux CRAB MEAT.  The pasta and truffle cream sauce was great - but when you put FISH (with strong fishy taste) on top it SUCKS!  We we went to Chef Marc's (Marc Sgrizzi) Trattoria because this dish was specifically written up in Las Vegas Weekly (June 6-14, page 14). We decided to give it a try. But Chef Marc's raising the price by 23% and serving FISH as CRAB is BAD, BAD, BAD. TERRIBLE!  The Las Vegas Weekly write up said "this unorthodox masterpiece .. fresh house-made black fettuccine gets all sauced up with truffle cream and quite a bit of jumbo lump crab meat." $26 (Chef Marc's printed menu was $32)  Now I am wondering why his previous restaurant - Parma - closed only to open this one 4 months later. ["A tipster writes in to Eater that the spot "hasn't been open for weeks" and the phone is disconnected. All the signs for the restaurant are still up, and there's no indication on the front door or on the restaurant's Facebook page and Website that it's closed permanently or indefinitely." by Susan Stapleton Jul 13, 2015]   SHAME, SHAME, SHAME

6Ui8j-6CjQD4CNP7FGlapQ.text: Oh. Em. Gee!!!!!! Fantastic Italian cuisine. Super friendly staff, and Chef Marc makes you feel special and recommends based on what you like. My husband got the Veal Chop Tartufo, and I got the Filet Mignon El Chico (medium rare). Both were the best Veal & Filet Mignon we've ever had. My husband didn't stop with the fork and knife; decided to say "screw utensils" literally chewed down to the bone with his hands. Hands down a new favorite, and cannot wait to come back!!  Special thanks to Chef Marc for the Anniversary Tiramisu,  the best!

u9rGgcKziqJu2aoityhxMQ.text: We love Chef Marcs! This charming family restaurant is a refreshing break from the corporate world of restaurant chains. We have just discovered it this year and are quickly becoming regulars! We love the warm welcome we receive, the amazing gourmet food (made in house), the consistency, the delicious cocktails, the amazing staff.... the list goes on! Oh! And the home made fresh bread that is placed on our table within minutes of sitting down.. YUM! How could I forget to mention the BEST happy hour in town??!   We will continue to dine at the 'best kept secret in Vegas!'

ez4KdB6RO7lBTruEEG9boQ.text: Chef Marc has such a huge following around the valley and it's for good reason. I wrote a review for his more casual Parma years ago, and was saddened (as everyone was) when it had closed. While it was a nice respite to be able to see his fresh pasta at farmers markets and to visit his pizza place (now also closed), I missed the sit down dining experience with his warm hospitality.  Enter Chef Marc's Trattoria. I bookmarked it shortly after opening but I'm ashamed to say that my mantra to eat less carbs (for some reason my brain doesn't count dumplings?) kept me from coming here as soon as I wanted to. It wasn't until my best friend was craving Italian that I suggested knowing JUST the place.  In summary, we were in the mood for classics. We shared a caesar salad which was exactly what you'd expect it to be although the dressing was just a touch lighter than most which was welcome. We also had the clams with linguine and the eggplant parmesan. Chef Marc came out to touch tables, as he does, and we got into it about different pasta textures, our favorites, and which hold different sauces better for different purposes etc. He mentioned that they had a house made bucatini that day, and I became VERY excited as thats my absolute favorite. I subbed that in for my pasta side alongside the eggplant parmesan.  The eggplant parm seemed less like it was dredged through breadcrumbs, and more like it was just crisp egg batter, and it was a welcome change. It gave the dish a lightness without sacrificing any of its silky richness. The bucatini was the first thing I finished- mm! The linguine with clams is just EXACTLY right. It hit all the right flavors and I still dream about it. Fresh clams, lemon, garlic, white wine, parsley and homemade pasta all humbly married together in harmony. It was spectacular.  If you're looking for classics, this is tops if you want to avoid the strip and breaking the bank. I have yet to try any of their more creative dishes, but look forward to the opportunity to visit again in the (hopefully) near future! Also, the music was on point with classics like Sinatra setting just the right mood.

GnbIEfrnozzb-BSGs_wT1Q.text: I guess you don't go to an Italian restaurant and eat fish!! Had a four course meal did not enjoy the halibut at all not even a lemon wedge! One of the waiters on the inside came out told me the fish was just swimming yesterday. Don't believe it if it was fresh it would've been flaky not mushie!! To make it right they took off Two cans of Coke .Classy not! Also one other drink. Gave us one dish of sorbet! Not bad  I guess they figured we wouldn't come back any why make it! I left a message told the Cook he should try the fish! Because no chef would have served that kind of fishy fish!! I don't know maybe they thought we were just looking for a discount but we took two bites of each of the fish terrible, mushy, Dry , extremely fishy!!  Service was good took us 30 minutes to get our salad!  Not the best experience By no means!!!

PIs0jiyA6MFZ503FZqtUmQ.text: Overpriced. Over-hyped. Rude waitress.   I cannot even confirm that we had fresh pasta.   Would love to elaborate but just not worth the trouble.  If spending $300 dollars for spaghetti makes you feel good, by all means, Chef Marc's Trattoria is your place.

Dpv5SrUH-4yyayyaqXeXdQ.text: Always a pleasure visiting this restaurant, Chef Marc himself comes out to greet you when he gets a chance, his food is amazing he puts pride into his dishes. Excellent atmosphere great food, great customer service.

Lr8IMwXBgTb0fEb7tPukEw.text: Chef Marc is amazing impeccable service impressive meals / CREATIVE MENU!! His wife makes the most delicious mouth watering desserts! Ambience is elegant light music/ family friendly- as well as date night!!! I love Chef Marc's fava salad with eggplant parm!!! The veal is to die for as well!! Tonight I tried The black linguini & crap what a HIT!!??

-oGUzV5w1JjR141idn9bXg.text: Such a nice Italian place !!! I had the linguine with clams and my husband the eggplant parmigiana and we are in love ! Furthermore Chef Marc took the time to see every customer at table... Italian food in Vegas is the place to be!

VTERpaCe-RirldDFH5qnYQ.text: ok the food is still great but i have no idea why there was like a Barry White soundtrack playing the whole time we were here. so confused, bring back Frank Sinatra pleeeeeaaaaase chef marc.

LVNn8vrP0CUqFdrNb_6j7A.text: Chef Marc came out himself several times to speak with us. I had the portobello to start which pretty much filled me up! Excellent old school Italian with a nice modern edge. I hope so be back again soon.

cu6idvBMm8Yw3xrFRhw0Hg.text: This place is amazing!!! The food is very good and I've lived in Summerlin for 20 years and never ever heard of Marc's Trattoria nor would Did I see this place as I always eat at Outback!  Great Job Chef Marc..... We will be back for sure....

YNw-9zrCIGZWVu3VZy67Bg.text: We tried this restaurant based on the yelp reviews.  I admit that the service was outstanding.  The food was good, but I can't really give it 5 stars.

wz2uWkqTWf4K-MaL5tJWSg.text: Me and my partner are both foodie's and love a superb dinner! Chef Marc's restaurant hit the bullseye from greeting us personally (and opening the door to the establishment himself), offering us a choice of a couple different table options, bringing us samples throughout our meal of other various menu items to try. Our server Giovanna was so attentive and so funny and we appreciated the sense of humor. Chef Marc and his team made us feel like we were eating great food in their own home. Thank you so much for the nice evening and dinner.

9dbcBIQV-1aHMnV66QsOyA.text: I loved this place.  The service was wonderful but more importantly the food was incredible.  It's like a trip to Tuscany or Rome.  The pasta tastes home made, which it is.  I tried all of my friend's dishes and they were all cooked to perfection.  The only thing 1/2 the group was not fond of was the complimentary pizza bread.  It was cold and had too much spice.  However the plain bread (which was warm) that was also in the basket was phenomenal.   I have been waiting for a place like this to open away from the strip.   The Chef also came around and made sure everyone was content.  A very nice touch.   If you feel like eating authentic Italian.  Give this place a shot.  It will not disappoint.  Also, for dessert: the tiramisu was (I hate to say it this way, but here it goes ....) to die for.   It was delicious!!!

CuBDpK2-Ti5t_TYTuu9Ycg.text: What a great dining experience, from speaking with Marc the Chef and hearing about the specials for the evening. Enjoying the dishes my husband, another couple and I ordered, and all agreeing we would come back again,very nice evening. Thanks again for a very evening.

IUhsOnkZRKa_2kTUhYz_kw.text: The Osso Bucco was delicious.  The service by Chef Marc & his team was 5 Star.   The menu is filled with great choices & everyone at our table if 10 was thrilled with their dinner.   Ambiance is very nice too.   Simply a great addition to Las Vegas!

m-_rixH_F0KiCYSjqg1fCA.text: What a gem of a restaurant!   We stopped here just because it was right next door to our hotel. Wow...  A small gem hidden away. The staff was very friendly and helpful without hovering. The waiter was very personable and answered all our questions and actually was able to personalize our dinners. Since we were having a bit of Carolina Reaper pepper added to our pasta, the xhef brought out two fresh peppers dor us to enjoy with iur bread and appetizers. The whole experience was remarkable.

JTrlCN-hwUH9W235EUR39Q.text: Food so authentic I am writing this before even asking for our bill.  Easily one of the Top 3 Italian restaurants I have ever been to. What a waitstaff, we had 4 different individuals regularly coming by our table. On top of their game.   Sinatra at the Wynn needs to learn from this gem how to treat its customers and deliver top service.  Chef Marc is incredible. He came to our table himself and explained in such detail about our options. His recommendations were absolutely spot on. So impressed even from what you think is a basic caesar salad is so much more.  Would highly recommend.   Made our anniversary very memorable.  Thanks all!

BKDF3xg7dHdTJSzsv_OCjg.text: Not 5 stars, TEN!! Don't walk- RUN here!!   Discovered this place from Yelp reviews so, even though I selfishly don't want to refer people here out of fear of not being able to get in, my conscience tells me I need to pay the favor forward & give thanks to Mark & ALL his team.   You know how they say- "If you want good Italian, you've gotta go to Italy". I bought into that school of law my entire life. I've eaten at every popular Italian spot in Vegas & I can tell you; The food will transport you back to Italy without leaving Vegas. Even better, it's equal to the top restaurants in Italy. I know, I know... I can hear what you're thinking; "That's a BOLD statement", and yes, yes it is. Also, a factual one. I dare you to challenge me, (just save me a table).   Chef Marc travels periodically to Italy to continue his study of Italian Cuisine so make sure you call ahead, when he's in Italy, they close for a couple weeks. He visits each table nightly & is so darn likable & obsessed with flavor, you'll want to invite him over to your house to cook, & he does catering, I asked.   The restaurant is comfortable with dark(ish) ambiance, has a good romantic vibe. Some tables are NYC style, close together, others tucked away in corners. They also have seating at the bar- lots of good choices!   Special shot out to the older gentleman maitre'd, his name I think is Luigi?? He's ADORABLE, get him chatting & he'll tell you lots of crazy stories about old Vegas lore.   We went last night & are going back tonight & bringing more friends. Will be our 5th trip in 2 months and that's w/ a break to Italy from Chef Marc. Don't judge- you'll be addicted too!

QFdN_Bd5MuPpIJpiFfW8WA.text: Great Experience.  The food at Chef Marc's surprised us.  We were expecting typical Italian fare, but were delighted with our dinner.  The food was light but expressive.  More of a Northern Italian style.  We started with a glass of Chianti and the hot seafood appetizer. A bountiful plate of clams, mussels, calamari, and eggplant was presented to us (large enough to be the dinner for the two of us, but we didn't stop with appetizers).  The shell fish were cooked to perfection, and the squid was perfectly cooked, not rubbery, but aldente and full of flavor.  My wife ordered the pasta with boar meat which had more of a taste of meat stock than it's tomato base, and I had the eggplant parm.  The eggplant was light and battered with egg.  A delightful dish which I enjoyed again as leftovers the next morning.  It was accompanied by a brimming bowl of delightfully tasty pasta.  Our desert and latte's were a wonderful conclusion to a delightful meal.  The service was exceptional, and we appreciated the chef coming to our table and introducing himself.  It was a perfect dinner to accompany a delightful evening.  Highly recommend.

9bnifykCghU83SiQGoL5Qw.text: Please let me take a moment of your time to tell you about this amazing restaurant. My husband and I discovered them 2 years ago and not only dine there at least once a month but have referred so many family & friends. Everyone we refer has agreed with us, Chef Marc's is the best! The food is amazing, the staff is so wonderful and the Chef himself is always there!  The staff goes above and beyond every time, even when they are slammed. They go out of their way to make your experience a wonderful one.   One of our favorite people is Giovanna, she not only takes amazing care of everyone in her section but when we told her we would be taking a trip to Italy she is helping us learn some Italian as well! Sam the bartender is so friendly and makes the best drinks!  I could go on and on, but in the end all you need to know is...Chef Marc's Trattoria is a cut above the rest.   If you are looking for the most amazing Italian dining experience this place has it. The ambiance, the staff, the food, the drinks, the Chef.

EvhgYtaVqqs2vYSOL2HSOg.text: This review is for the restaurant week menu.  Our reservation was at 6:15 PM and the restaurant was doing a brisk business. Most tables were occupied. The staff was energized and Chef Marc was busy helping the servers which left little time to talk to the customers as he usually does. However, I was able to get his attention and congratulate him on a fantastic menu.  The menu was a four course dinner with an choice of one from two items in each course. Our choice was: Imported Buratta Salad with Arugula, Cabernet tomatoes and Balsamic dressing. The cheese was silky and paired well with the sweet tomatoes and fresh greens   Mussels Farro, from Apulia & Adriatic sea with farro, beans and  Mirepoix. This dish was like a seafood stew with only one item from sea. Different but delicious.  Pappardelle Wild Boar Bolognese, fresh made pasta with Chef Marc's Tuscan Bolognese. Wow a fantastic dish. Perfectly cooked pasta and a wonderful tasting Boar Bolognese. This is a meal in itself.  Ora King Salmon, oven roasted and herb crusted. A nice piece of juicy salmon. It was the perfect size after the previous courses. Although, not part of the dinner our server provided a side dish of Broccolini.  Dessert was not part of the dinner and was not missed as there was no room   Kudos to Chef Marc and his team for a very enjoyable dinner.

The specials are a bit pricey at $50+ compared to other pasta and meat dishes on the menu, however I will say they were devoured by folks eating with me.  They have a good wine list and reasonably priced.  The chef also made his rounds to each table which is always a nice touch.  I will definitely be visiting again.

YpjOCF12Tbaasjko1I9hRg.text: Thank you, Yelp! You guided me to this little slice of Italian heaven and I am forever grateful. Let's go through the checklist: Quickly seated ,  Personable staff:  Simple, focused menu:  Delicious food:  Personally talked with Chef Marc who provided great context and advice on the menu:   What an amazing time. We had the Vegetarian Ravioli for an app, the Ora King Salmon (to DIE for) and the Duck Ragu. And we topped it off with a slice of Lemoncello Cake. We'll be back for sure!

IhkiR0xcbyOPVvdonNd-4w.text: Everything about this place was fantastic . The customer service was some of the best I've ever had . Our waiter was so knowledgeable about all of the menu items and he made everything sound sooo good . The entire staff was so attentive and friendly . The chef even came out and greeted us twice .   Every single thing that I put in my mouth was exceptional . Let's start with the bread . They brought us out both homemade wheat and white bread and both were delicious . The crust was so crispy and the bread was warm .   We got the greens and they were very different from anything I've ever tried but were very tasty . I ordered the wedding soup and it was honestly one of the best soups I've ever tried . The broth is homemade along with everything else in this soup . This one is a must ! Now on to the main entrees ... I ordered the Wild Shrimp Fra Diavola and I loved it . I shared it with my mother and they split it for us . Even with us sharing we both didn't finish it . It was a great , large size portion . They ask you how spicy ( on a scale form 1-4) , I chose a 2 and it wasn't really spicy. I would definitely do a 4 next time . My step father ordered the Bucatini All'Amatriciana and that was fantastic . So flavorful and the guanciale was so crispy .   Finally we ordered a " Banofee Pie" and they it came out with a cheesecake gelato . It tastes like bananas foster on a dark chocolate crust ... and the cheesecake gelato ... OMG !   This place was such a gem . We all loved it !!! I would absolutely come back . If you are looking for some authentic Italian food , THIS IS YOUR PLACE .

photos.caption: Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Utica Greens
Photo of Chef Marc's Trattoria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Shrimp Fra Diavola

TvSuIDmBwnfWQO6L1Mue7w.text: Maybe it was a bad night for the restaurant, but it was inexcusable how they handled it and how poor the quality of the food was. We came here because of my friend's birthday because it was in the Desert Companion guide for being so good.   I cannot fathom how this restaurant is rated so well. Our experience started with being sat at 7pm (while others had already been dining for a while) and being told they were still putting together the menu for the night. This was actually exciting to us since it created an "authentic" feel. We ordered appetizers and entrees with our heavily accented and unprepared server (we gave her a Post-it because she didn't have a pad...) and began to wait. Our salads, appetizers, and the child's spaghetti and meatballs were brought out relatively quickly, but then we waited...and waited...and waited for another hour before our server came back at all.  At first the wait was nice. Most of us hadn't seen each other in a while and it was pleasant catching up. We had an amazingly well-behaved toddler with us who was almost falling asleep the second hour we were here since it was way past her bed time. Our water glasses were emptied and refilled twice in the hour of not hearing from or seeing our server and we were getting very hungry. Our server finally dained to swing by and let us know that their oven broke and our food should be out shortly...then, as she was about to walk away, though it was an afterthought, apologized for the wait. Then came the food.  The first two dishes that came out were incredible. The ribeye and pork chop looked (and tasted) fantastic. Everyone at the table could smell them and got excited for our own dishes. Next was the eggplant parm and octopus pasta. Covered in cheese, thick, juicy eggplant, and the smell all looked fantastic and made me really excited for my chicken parm! Here is where the True issues we had with the restaurant began.   The octopus pasta looked good, but not anything like the rest of the entrees. I found out later that the octopus was overcooked and the pasta undercooked. Then came the wild boar dish and my chicken parm. The boar dish (ordered by the aforementioned birthday girl) looked like green vomit on a plate and, according to the friend who got it, tasted much the same. My chicken parm was under-sauced (usually this is preferred, but something needed to mask the chicken), the sauce was of a poor quality and VERY acidic, had little cheese, and the chicken cutlets were miserable. It was like the chef had never heard of another seasoning besides salt. The chicken was dry, over-breaded, and reminded me of cheap chicken nuggets from a knockoff fast food joint. The accompanying pasta they brought out was under-cooked, so nothing pleasant there.  We were very polite about it and didn't complain until the manager and server pestered us twice each. From there, my friend's octopus dish was returned and removed from the check. They tried to give us desserts when we didn't want them, tried to convince us to have dessert, offered it to the now sleep-drunk child without permission AFTER we had turned down dessert repeatedly. The manager said he would do something about the rest of the awful dishes and must have forgotten because we got the check with only the octopus dish removed. We paid it and were asked multiple times if we were coming back. We declined to answer, to try and not be rude, but they knew...and kept asking over and over.  How did I have time to write such a long review? Well, that's a gift from the restaurant as well. The best part of this meal is that it caused me to lose some weight...because I'm now home with food poisoning. I'm exhausted, dehydrated, and beyond irate. If anyone from the restaurant decides to check out their reviews, know that we will NEVER be back.

63fHAEPThkpya8vk8VPCQw.text: Excellent Italian food, thank you Yelpers for the reviews. Started with great bread and an amazing server. Linguine Nero was very tasty. I got it spicy which paired well with the black pasta, calamari, and shrimp. The barata cheese salad was superb with fresh and tender tomatoes. Chicken Parmesan and cabenara were also very good.   You have to ask for Giovanna, she was a great server - fun and made good recommendations.   We'll be back.

MqLaRLkhH9D30CxktS1uAg.text: Probably one of my favorite secret-hidden gems in town. Portions are large and absolutely delicious. Don't skip the dessert! The tiramisu was the icing on the cake for my meal. I love how quiet and hidden away the restaurant is.

bf6wb1Q_Ic5rOmJOHUkOjQ.text: I love Chef Marc's cooking and passion, but this latest location is a buzz kill on the dining experience. The space had an odd layout when it was a previous Italian restaurant and it remains so. There is no ambiance and the setting conflicts with the caliber of his food. Piping in Sinatra standards doesn't do the trick.  You can't really go wrong with any of the menu selections. Pastas are made fresh and their sauces are spot on. We enjoyed the burrata, cesar, chicken parm, rigatoni and tiramisu. The new space is meant to showcase Chef Marc's wonderful talent and provide a special experience. I felt l was dining in the Embassy Suites lobby for breakfast with people who just came from the gym.

C4iBpDTtUTgkT6k4g5_0Ng.text: It was decent. We had a large group of 15, food was good service was alright. It was nice the chef came Over and talked about the menu and introduced himself. Waitress wasn't super attentive to us... but water was refilled frequently never empty. Food was a lil over priced but cooked well. We did have a pork chop undercooked. And had to be taken back to the kitchen would have been nice for the chef to personal come apologize. Half of the group got their food and then the other half ten mins later which was annoying.

umry8Mso-nP6DR-XGUcMXg.text: Charming local place in which the owner plays a personal role in every aspect of the restaurant. I ordered the linguine with clams in a white wine sauce with haste as this was my go to meal across my trip in Southern Italy before Chef Marc could come to my table with a recommendation. He came by after I had placed my order, though and regularly checked in throughout my meal.  In the conversations I could overhear, I think it would be best to listen to him describe the meals as well as make recommendations as he really does it justice that way. It was like listening to chefs on food network describe their food with passion and detail. He was very personable and friendly to all customers, and knows a lot of them by name. I heard him check with the kitchen about my order as I had been sitting for a bit, but I didn't mind. My meal came and it did look different than the pictures. The clams were cooked well, it wasn't rubbery. But as I worked my way through the clams there was unfortunately many crunchy, unwanted surprises. This was also prevalent throughout the pasta itself. I brought this to the attention of Chef Marc who then swapped it out with a squid ink seafood pasta which was exceptionally cooked. The pasta was cooked well and the seafood had a nice bite to it.  I asked where he sources his seafood in which he knew the route and locations in which they all travelled, which I highly appreciated. He switches suppliers depending on the season for optimal taste.   TLDR; I will return as the second dish Chef Marc personally recommended was far more up to the other Yelpers standards they had set. I appreciate his artistry, passion, and dedication to his work and hope this restaurant thrives.

t1GyOiZTv89qoxC8PTc9sQ.text: If you haven't tried Chef Marc's.  Make a reservation NOW!  We've been dying to dine with Chef Marc but unfortunately for us, they are also closed on Tuesdays. Last Friday, we made a reservation and committed to ditching work and have a date night  Greeted by the cutest elderly host into a well AC room! (I've got to say, that AC in these summer days is a win already!)   Chef Marc found sometime to come out and greeted each guest personally which made us feel like home.  We ordered the pork chop that was teasing us on Instagram for months and a special, Linguini with grilled octopus.  Both plates were absolutely delicious!! perfect al dente linguini, tender octopus, and the Carolina Reaper chilis in the pork chop burn sooooo good we keep going back for more.  Needless to say, we're so happy to have finally tried Chef Marc.  The details and the passion shows in every bite and we felt like we're actually in Italy! what a sweet escape.   Not to mention Chef Marc is super supportive and gave so much advice and pointers to help our little start up grow and we have the utmost respect for such a kind human being.  Thanks Chef!

XAVGCFXigagn_XtPZjaCrQ.text: Finally had a chance to try Chef Marc's and I have nothing but good things to say! I'm mostly writing this review for  1. The portobello mushroom/cheese/spinach starter and 2. The linguine with grilled octopus entree Both of these dishes along with the rest of our order were  amazing. They have a wonderful wait staff and we had plenty of chances to chat with Chef. We ended our meal with three delicious desserts. Such a wonderful experience so close to home!

yNuonwTqfr6XwnLQNiyrOQ.text: Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. And I'm a foody. Antoenette is a perfect delight. It's always a pleasure to be served by her. Chef Marc is of course an amazing chef! I always recommend trying the specials. They're willing to customize anything for you. Chef will custom make a vegan, gluten-free, oil-free dish for your dietary and lifestyle needs.

45sGv7ppUrEIRIHL-QWNoQ.text: Six of us were sitting at Chef Marc's Trattoria ...and our taste couldn't be more different from each other..."Hard to please" kind of crowd ....Oh well, at the end of our meal, we surrender to the polished service of staff and the delightful dishes from Chef Marc!  We opted out for the chef's tasting menu...some of us shared our dietary restrictions with staff...no dairy, no lamb, etc.  No problem!!  At the end, we all have  our happy endings!    Chef Marc's Trattoria now has its own wine cellar with variety of selections to please your savvy palette while you are enjoying homemade pasta or elegant Italian cusine by Chef.   I'm not an Italian but know how to appreciate traditional, fresh, chewy pasta.   Thank you Chef Marc!  -2018 review #14-
